text.section: In this section, "Fund" means the Community Health Resources Commission Fund.
There is a Community Health Resources Commission Fund.

section.section: The Fund is a special, nonlapsing fund that is not subject to § 7-302 of the State Finance and Procurement Article.
The Treasurer shall hold the Fund separately, and the Comptroller shall account for the Fund.

The funding for a unified data information system under paragraph (1)(iv) of this subsection shall be limited to:
$500,000 in fiscal year 2006; and
$1,700,000 in fiscal year 2007 and annually thereafter.

text.section:
Grants awarded to a community health resource under this section may be used:
To provide operational assistance to a community health resource; and
For any other purpose the Commission determines is appropriate to assist a community health resource.

section.section: The Treasurer shall invest the money in the Fund in the same manner as other State money may be invested.
Any investment earnings of the Fund shall be retained to the credit of the Fund.

text.section: The Fund shall be subject to an audit by the Office of Legislative Audits as provided for in § 2-1220 of the State Government Article.
